lines.text:
[to a table of drunks]
Listen you guys, cut out the rough stuff or I'll feed you to the lions. The kid's cigarettes will be on your check. Enjoy yourselves... gentlemen.
Who do you think's gonna get the worst of this - Maxie, or Africa?

[amidst animal growls]
It can't be; we're a hundred miles from that country - but it is, I swear it is! Ali, get me my gun - *big* gun!
You can't rope a gorilla!

[after O'Hara and Crawford have fled]
Aren't you afraid of Joe?
I sure am, but I don't want him to know it.
Come on, Windy, I got a million things to do.
You got time for this.
[turns on movie projector. Jill and Gregg come into the scene]
Hey, it's the kids!
Crawford told me to spring it on you. He shot it when he was down there.

[calling to the screen]
Hey, Jill.

[silently]
Hello Max.
Hey, they said "Hello, Max".

[Joe walks into the scene. O'Hara steps back]
*Yipe*.

[clutching his chest and staggering]
Oh! I think I'm gonna have another heart attack!

[pushing O'Hara into a police car]
Fine, have it in there!
Don't worry kid. There's nobody in the world gonna shoot Joe now.
We're goin' to Africa- we're gonna lassoo lions.
But Maxie, you can buy all the lions you want in California!

[Dramatically]
But don't you understand? I'm going to be in terrible danger - in darkest Africa!
Am I dreamin', or did I just see a gorilla? And a beautiful dame!
Maxie, I can get you a great act; it can work on a raft.
What?
Monkeys!
Aw, nix, cut it out, will ya'?

[In response to a patron asking about the safety glass that shields her from the lions]
Don't worry, lady; O'Hara had it made special.
[raps his knuckles on the glass twice]
That'll hold *anything*.

[walking through the Golden Safari]
Gee, this looks just like Africa.
How would you know? You've never been out of the state.

[condescendingly to her escort as they are being led to an upstairs table]
And I thought you knew every headwaiter in town.

[to Windy]
Who's the greatest press agant in the world, you or me; don't answer that.

[to the painter putting O'Hara's name on the door]
No, no it isn't *big* enough.
